alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 22 at 6:23PM MDT until May 22 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The East Troublesome burn scar in... North Central Grand County in north central Colorado... * Until 915 PM MDT. * At 623 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the East Troublesome Burn Scar. Between 0.2 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the central East Troublesome Burn area. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the East Troublesome Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the East Troublesome Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Grand County This includes the following additional locations... Lower Stillwater Creek, Stillwater Pass, Middle Willow Creek Valley and Lower Willow Creek Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
